item.title: 自由港麦克莫兰公司季度利润超预期，得益于铜价上涨
item.description: 矿业公司自由港麦克莫兰周四公布的第四季度利润超出华尔街预期，得益于铜价上涨。【原文：Miner Freeport-McMoRan beat Wall Street estimates for fourth-quarter profit on Thursday, boosted by higher copper prices.】

item.title: 派拉蒙将对华纳兄弟的敌意收购截止日期延长至2月20日
item.description: 派拉蒙与天空舞影业周四将对华纳兄弟探索公司的敌意收购要约截止日期延长至2月20日，以此争取更多时间说服投资者，其对这家好莱坞制片厂的收购要约优于网飞提出的竞争性交易方案。【原文：Paramount Skydance on Thursday extended the deadline on its hostile tender offer for Warner Bros Discovery to February 20, giving it more time to persuade investors that its bid for the Hollywood studio trumps a rival deal with Netflix.】

item.title: 科鲁拉酱料制造商麦考密克公司预测，受关税和投入成本上升影响，年度利润将疲软。
item.description: 辣酱制造商麦考密克周四预测，2026财年利润将低于分析师预期。在宏观经济不确定性加剧的背景下，关税和商品价格上涨导致成本上升，挤压了企业利润空间。【原文：Hot sauce maker McCormick on Thursday forecast fiscal 2026 profit below analysts' estimates, as higher costs from tariffs and commodities squeeze margins amid macroeconomic uncertainty.】

item.title: 哈塞特表示，新任美联储主席应是"独立人士"，且尊重法定职责。
item.description: 白宫顾问凯文·哈塞特——这位角逐美联储主席杰罗姆·鲍威尔继任者的候选人之一——周四接受CNBC采访时表示，美联储新任主席应是"尊重法定职责的独立人士"。【原文：White House adviser Kevin Hassett, one of the candidates in the running to replace Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell, told CNBC in an interview on Thursday that the central bank's new chair should be "an independent person who respects the mandates".】

item.title: 哥伦比亚暂停电力销售，对厄瓜多尔征收30%关税，贸易争端不断升级
item.description: 哥伦比亚周四早间宣布，将对厄瓜多尔的20种产品征收30%的关税，并已暂停向该邻国出售电力。此前一天，厄瓜多尔以哥伦比亚未能共同打击毒品走私为由对哥产品加征关税，哥伦比亚政府对此指控予以坚决驳斥。【原文：Colombia said early on Thursday that it will impose a 30% tariff on 20 products from Ecuador and that it has suspended electricity sales to the neighboring country, a day after Ecuador announced charges on Colombian products because of the alleged failure to work together against drug trafficking, an allegation the Colombian government has roundly rejected.】

item.title: 印度赛英公司季度利润下滑，因一次性劳动法相关费用
item.description: 印度赛英公司周四报告称，受该国新修订劳动法规产生的一次性费用影响，其第三季度利润下滑24.9%。【原文：India's Cyient reported a 24.9% fall in third-quarter profit on Thursday due to a one-time charge from the country's new revised labour codes.】

item.title: Mobileye预测年度营收低于预期
item.description: 自动驾驶技术公司Mobileye Global周四预测其年度营收将低于华尔街预期，这表明电动汽车产量放缓正对其驾驶辅助技术的需求造成压力。【原文：Self-driving tech company Mobileye Global forecast annual revenue below Wall Street expectations on Thursday, a sign that slower electric-vehicle production is weighing on demand for its driver assistance technology.】

item.title: 宝洁公司营收略低于预期，但经调整利润超出目标值
item.description: 宝洁公司周四公布的第二季度营收略低于华尔街预期，主要受美国洗衣液和卫生纸等核心品类消费疲软拖累，其美容产品业务的强劲表现未能抵消这一影响。【原文：Procter & Gamble on Thursday fell just short of Wall ​Street expectations for its second-quarter revenue, held back by weak consumer spending in core categories such as ‌U.S. laundry detergent and toilet paper, which overshadowed strength in its beauty products.】

item.title: 地缘政治动荡或将考验欧元区银行外汇融资能力，风险机构警告
item.description: 欧洲系统性风险委员会周四警告称，若地缘政治不确定性持续高企，欧元区银行可能难以在市场上融资，尤其是在美元及其他外币融资方面。【原文：Euro area banks might find it hard to finance themselves on the market, particularly in U.S. dollars and other foreign currencies, if high geopolitical uncertainty persists, the European Systemic Risk Board warned on Thursday.】

item.title: 晨间报价：达沃斯放松
item.description: 当今美国及全球市场中真正重要的因素【原文：What matters in U.S. and global markets today】

item.title: 独家：欧盟-南共市协定或将于3月起临时生效
item.description: 欧盟一名外交官周四向路透社透露，尽管欧盟最高法院即将对此案作出裁决，欧盟与南美国家签署的自由贸易协定很可能最早于3月开始临时实施。【原文：The EU's free trade deal with South American countries will probably be applied on a ​provisional basis as soon as March, an EU diplomat ‌told Reuters on Thursday, despite a looming challenge at the bloc's top court.】

item.title: 通用电气航空预测2026年利润将因售后市场强劲表现而超出预期
item.description: 通用电气航空周四预测年度利润将超出预期，主要得益于高利润率售后零部件及服务需求的强劲增长。由于飞机供应受限，航空公司预计将优先考虑维护支出。【原文：GE Aerospace forecast annual profit above estimates on Thursday, driven by strong demand for high-margin aftermarket parts and services as ​airlines are expected to prioritize maintenance spending due to aircraft supply constraints.】

item.title: 期货价格因格陵兰岛救灾消息进一步上涨
item.description: 美国股市期货周四上涨，显示华尔街出现新的买盘动能。此前美国总统特朗普放弃对欧洲国家加征关税的威胁，缓解了市场对新一轮全球贸易战的担忧。【原文：U.S. ​stock index futures rose on Thursday, signaling fresh buying momentum on Wall ‌Street after President Donald Trump backed down from threats to impose tariffs against European countries, easing concerns about a new global trade war.】

item.title: 梅赛德斯公布2026款F1赛车图片，宣布与微软达成合作协议
item.description: 梅赛德斯周四宣布与微软达成重大新赞助协议，同时揭晓了W17一级方程式赛车的图片。这位前冠军车队希望凭借这款赛车在本赛季重返巅峰。【原文：Mercedes announced a major new sponsorship deal with Microsoft on Thursday as they revealed images of the W17 Formula One car that the former champions hope will take them back to the top this season.】

item.title: 全球最大肉类加工企业JBS计划将沙特新工厂产量翻倍
item.description: 全球最大肉类企业JBS周四发表声明称，其位于沙特阿拉伯城市吉达的新建鸡肉加工厂将在2026年底前将产量提升一倍。【原文：The world's largest meat company JBS will double production output in its new chicken processing plant in the Saudi Arabian city of Jeddah by the end of 2026, according to a statement on Thursday.】

item.title: 西捷航空座位政策大转弯，揭露航空公司压缩经济舱乘客空间的风险
item.description: 加拿大西捷航空上周突然叫停了经济舱座椅缩减计划，此前多段视频在网络疯传，显示乘客因腿部空间狭窄而苦不堪言。此次政策逆转为北美航空公司敲响了警钟——这些公司正通过缩减空间、削减后舱原有标准服务等方式，重新设计客舱布局以迎合高消费旅客。【原文：Canada's WestJet abruptly walked back a rollout of tighter economy seating last week after viral videos showed passengers struggling with cramped legroom. The U-turn offered a sharp warning to North American airlines redesigning cabins to favor higher‑paying travelers, often by trimming space and cutting once‑standard perks in the back of the plane.】

item.title: Coupang投资者要求美国调查韩国处理数据泄露事件的方式
item.description: 两家美国大型投资者周四表示，已向美国政府提交请愿书，要求调查韩国政府对电商企业Coupang的歧视性待遇，并可能采取贸易救济措施。【原文：Two major U.S. investors in Coupang Inc said on Thursday they have petitioned the U.S. government to investigate the South Korean government and potentially impose trade remedies over what they describe as discriminatory ​treatment of the e-commerce company.】

item.title: 苹果公司请求印度法院阻止反垄断机构索取其财务资料
item.description: 法庭文件显示，苹果公司已向印度法院申请，要求阻止该国反垄断监管机构在调查其应用商店政策时索取其全球财务记录，同时该公司正对相关法律的有效性提出质疑。【原文：Apple has asked an Indian court to stop the country's antitrust watchdog from seeking its global financial records as part of an investigation into its app store policies, while it challenges the underlying law's validity, court papers show.】

item.title: 人力资源公司万宝盛华预计，经历艰难的2025年后，全球招聘市场将趋于稳定。
item.description: 万宝盛华集团认为，经历艰难的2025年后，全球人力资源市场正趋于稳定。尽管雇主和员工在地缘政治与贸易不确定性中仍持谨慎态度，但经济形势的改善有望为2026年行业增长奠定基础。【原文：ManpowerGroup sees the global staffing market ​stabilising after a difficult ‌2025 and says improving economic conditions could set up the industry for growth in ‌2026, even as employers and ​workers remain cautious amid geopolitical and trade uncertainty.】

item.title: 美国监管机构试图绕过印度政府向阿达尼集团送达传票
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会已向美国法院申请许可，拟通过电子邮件直接向印度亿万富翁高塔姆·阿达尼及其集团高管萨加尔·阿达尼发出传票，指控其涉嫌欺诈及参与2.65亿美元贿赂计划。相关文件显示。【原文：The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission has asked a U.S. court for permission to personally email summons to Indian billionaire Gautam Adani and group executive Sagar Adani over alleged fraud and a $265 million bribery scheme, filings show.】

item.title: 美国能源部长在达沃斯呼吁全球石油产量翻番
item.description: 美国能源部长克里斯·赖特周四表示，全球石油产量需增加一倍以上。他同时批评欧盟和美国加利福尼亚州将资金浪费在所谓低效的绿色能源上。【原文：The world needs to more than double oil production, U.S. Energy Secretary Chris Wright said on Thursday, while criticising the European Union and the U.S. state of California for wasting money on what he described as inefficient green energy.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织官员在达沃斯表示，稳定币可能对货币体系构成竞争压力
item.description: 国际货币基金组织第一副总裁周四表示，部分国家采用稳定币的做法可能迫使这些国家改进其财政和货币框架。【原文：The IMF's first deputy managing director said on Thursday that the uptake of stablecoins in some countries could put pressure on those countries to improve their fiscal and monetary frameworks.】

item.title: 北约秘书长称盟国必须加强北极安全，在与特朗普的格陵兰协议中
item.description: 北约秘书长马克·鲁特表示，在与美国达成框架协议后，西方盟国需要加强在北极的存在。此前一天，美国总统唐纳德·特朗普收回了以关税威胁或武力夺取格陵兰岛的言论。【原文：NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte said that Western allies will need to step up their presence in the Arctic under a framework deal with the U.S., a day after President Donald Trump walked back threats to use tariffs or seize Greenland by force.】

item.title: 达沃斯新贸易格局初现端倪，全球正适应特朗普关税政策
item.description: 唐纳德·特朗普总统将关税作为外交政策工具的做法，本周在达沃斯为推动美国以外地区全球贸易增长注入了新的动力，而华盛顿许多主要贸易伙伴对此明显感到沮丧。【原文：President Donald Trump's use of tariffs as a foreign policy tool added fresh impetus in Davos this week to efforts to boost global trade beyond the U.S., with frustration palpable among many of Washington's top trading partners.】

item.title: 台湾仁宝警告内存价格上涨将影响行业直至2027年
item.description: 台湾的仁宝电脑公司（一家笔记本电脑和个人电脑的代工制造商）表示，内存价格的飙升将持续到2027年，并对整个行业产生重大影响。【原文：Taiwan's Compal , a contract manufacturer for notebook and personal computers, said surging memory prices would continue into 2027 and have a significant impact on the industry.】

item.title: 中国吉利汽车计划到2030年实现全球销量突破650万辆
item.description: 中国吉利控股集团周四表示，计划到2030年实现全球销量突破650万辆，届时其年收入预计将超过1万亿元人民币（合1436.2亿美元）。【原文：China's Geely Holding Group (GEELY.UL) said on Thursday that it targets global sales of over 6.5 million vehicles by 2030 when its annual revenue is estimated to top 1 trillion yuan ($143.62 billion).】

item.title: 据彭博社报道，阿里巴巴计划为旗下人工智能芯片制造子公司T-Head筹备首次公开募股（IPO）。
item.description: 据彭博社周四报道，阿里巴巴正准备将其芯片制造部门T-Head上市，消息人士透露了这一情况。【原文：Alibaba is preparing to list its chipmaking arm, T-Head, Bloomberg News reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 大众汽车股价跃居德国DAX指数榜首，此前该公司报告汽车业务现金流表现强劲
item.description: 大众汽车股价周四跃居德国蓝筹股DAX指数榜首，此前这家欧洲最大汽车制造商公布其汽车部门2025年净现金流超出预期。【原文：Shares in Volkswagen jumped to the top of Germany's blue-chip DAX index on Thursday after Europe's biggest carmaker reported better-than-expected 2025 net cash flow in its automotive division.】

item.title: 育碧股价暴跌，《刺客信条》制作方宣布重组并取消多款游戏
item.description: 育碧股价周四暴跌，此前这家法国电子游戏发行商宣布进行全面重组，并表示将取消六款游戏项目。【原文：Shares in Ubisoft plunged on Thursday after the French video game publisher announced a sweeping reorganisation and said it would cancel six games.】

item.title: 马斯克将于周四在达沃斯发表演讲
item.description: 根据世界经济论坛更新的日程安排，特斯拉首席执行官埃隆·马斯克将于当地时间周四下午4点30分（格林尼治时间15:30）在达沃斯论坛参与一场专题讨论会，与会者还包括贝莱德首席执行官拉里·芬克。【原文：Tesla CEO Elon Musk will take part in a panel at Davos at 4:30 p.m. local time (1530 GMT) on Thursday with Blackrock CEO Larry Fink, according to the schedule updated by the World Economic Forum.】
